Issues.Title: [Regression] Designer fails to load with multi target frameworks.
Issues.Body:
### Environment

17.11.5

### .NET version

.Net8 and .Net9

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Yes in .Net 7 and .Net 6.

### Issue description

Designer fail to load with:
`<TargetFrameworks>net8.0-windows;net7.0-windows</TargetFrameworks>`

But load normally with:
- `<TargetFrameworks>net8.0-windows</TargetFrameworks>`
- `<TargetFrameworks>net7.0-windows;net8.0-windows</TargetFrameworks>`


### Steps to reproduce

[DesignerFail.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17310226/DesignerFail.zip)

- Build repro app.
- Try to open `SampleMain\MainForm.cs` form in designer - will see an error.

Modify `ChartSamples.csproj` to - `<TargetFrameworks>net8.0-windows</TargetFrameworks>` or `<TargetFrameworks>net7.0-windows;net8.0-windows</TargetFrameworks>` and restart VS.
Try to open `SampleMain\MainForm.cs` form in designer - the designer will open normally.



### Diagnostics

                           at System.Reflection.CustomAttribute.GetCustomAttributes(RuntimeModule decoratedModule, Int32 decoratedMetadataToken, Int32 pcaCount, RuntimeType attributeFilterType)
                           at System.Reflection.CustomAttribute.GetCustomAttributes(RuntimeType type, RuntimeType caType, Boolean inherit)
                           at System.Attribute.GetCustomAttributes(MemberInfo element, Boolean inherit)
                           at System.Composition.TypedParts.Util.DirectAttributeContext.GetCustomAttributes(Type reflectedType, MemberInfo member)
                           at System.Composition.Convention.AttributedModelProviderExtensions.GetDeclaredAttribute[TAttribute](AttributedModelProvider convention, Type reflectedType, MemberInfo member)

Issues.Title: An error dialog pops up if adding new item to project when form designer is "waiting for IntelliSense to finish initializing"
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 10 SDK build: 10.0.100-alpha.1.24508.48

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, just repro after installed .NET 10 SDK build to create a .NET 9.0 app

### Issue description

After installed .NET 10 SDK build from [main branch](https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/blob/main/documentation/package-table.md), an error dialog pops up if adding new item: user control/form to project when form designer shows "waiting for IntelliSense to finish initializing". If close this error dialog, the item is added successfully, and build app without any error.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7b717acf-1536-48ba-8de0-8c11cb194948)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/363d3af9-7d7f-4123-9608-4dfe41a2c4cd

If form designer is fully loaded, then to add new item, this issue cannot repro.
If uninstall .NET 10 SDK, this issue doesn't repro.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms app with targeting .NET 9.0 in a new instance
2. When form designer shows "waiting for intellisense to finish initializing", Ctrl+Shift+A to add a new item: usercontrol/form quickly
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "An error dialog pops up if adding new item to project when form designer is "waiting for IntelliSense to finish initializing"" (#12294)

Issues.Title: [DarkMode] 'Application' does not contain a definition for 'SetColorMode' after .NET 10.0 is installed
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.100-rc.2.24474.11

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

This is a new feature Dark Mode: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11857

### Issue description

When enable DarkMode by Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark) in Program.cs file with .NET 10.0 installed, there are 2 errors as follows:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5b2171fe-8b1c-413e-8d8a-de016c09bb5e)

**More Info:** After uninstalling .NET 10.0, the 2 errors disappeared
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5f556f40-60fb-4a53-a1b0-e1fe56fed15c)




### Steps to reproduce

Issues.Title: [release/8.0] Ensure proper ref count of underlying ocx
Issues.Body:
Backport of #12281 to release/8.0

## Customer Impact
Upon doing improvements to our interop code, we had missed releasing a pointer to the underlying ocx of the AxHost control, which was causing the underlying ocx to linger even after customer AxHost control is disposed. This causes the destructor of the underlying ocx to not get called because it still has a ref count of 1, causing issues with resource management in their application.

## Testing
Tested manually with customer repro scenario and added regression test for the scenario.

## Risk
Low. Change involves releasing the pointer we missed, correcting the ref count.

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/12289)

Issues.Title: Ensure proper ref count of underlying ocx
Issues.Body:
Fixes https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/12056

We had missed a release in `CreateWithoutLicense`, causing the underlying ocx to linger after `AxHost` control disposal. Made the same adjustment for `CreateWithLicense`. While investigating also noticed a missing release for `ShowPropertyPages` so fixed this as well. Regression test has been added for this issue scenario.

Issues.Title: Tweak visibility for WPF
Issues.Body:
Added the full set of runtime assemblies with (hopefully) the right keys. Test assemblies will eventually need added.

I've introduced constants for the public key values to make this a little easier to update / follow. I didn't update all of the usages, anyone else can do so, or I'll eventually pick it off when it is convenient.

This also moves some interop down to Core and does some renaming. It is intentional that I did not change the name of some of the files to allow history to be easily kept. I'll update names to match in future pulls.

Issues.Title: Switch default feed to use wildcards only
Issues.Body:
We can apparently use wildcards for our default feed. I moved that feed to be last for clarity.

I learned that NuGet will pick the longest pattern that matches a package and then use that package source.

Issues.Title: [HDPI] SystemAware - wrong Form.ClientSize with DPI other than 100%
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.7

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Behavior is identical with .Net versions from 5.0 to 8.07.
.NET Framework 4.8. have similar issues but size error is smaller.

### Issue description

SystemAware (or PerMonitorV2 starting scale) will calculate wrong Form.ClientSize for dpi more than 100%.
The problem was discovered in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/12132#issuecomment-2382306850.
See screenshots.
![net48](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dcc6e805-7263-45ed-ba32-faa1537747a0)
![net807](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/15df37c7-0adf-4c37-a042-89a6474af335)



### Steps to reproduce

[WinForms_DPI_SystemAware.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17255893/WinForms_DPI_SystemAware.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[HDPI] SystemAware - wrong Form.ClientSize with DPI other than 100%" (#12270)
